page.title: 16Historic Buildings
page.content: The historic buildings in the district owe much to the powerful presence of the Wynn family, landowners in the 16th and 17th centuries. Gwydir Castle was John Wynn's residence, completed in 1555, and Gwydir Uchaf 16O4 was the Dower house situated on the high land west of the castle. Much altered over the centuries, the castle was badly damaged in the 192O's, restored by Arthur Clegg, and is open to the public as a tourist attraction by the present owners. Gwydir Uchaf (Upper) lies on the eastern edge of Gwydyr Forest, and is used as the district offices of the Forestry Commission, which mounts exhibitions of forestry practice and wild life of the district. Nearby is Gwydir Uchaf chapel built in 1673. Interested visitors can obtain the key at a cottage close by.
